preqs: OHS1000 and either IDE1802 or ENG1501 or ENG1050 or MEC2403

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {OHS1000} and  (Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {ENG1050, ENG1501} or  Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {MEC2403} or  Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {IDE1802}))

description: This unit broadens the student's understanding of the use and properties of materials in product design. There is a particular emphasis upon new and emerging materials and processes and volumes of production. Lectures cover the following areas of study; comparative assembly techniques, automated assembly, recycling and disassembly, surface treatments, guidelines for designing mouldings; fastening and joining techniques.
faculty: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture
